thread.title: South Alabama holds on to 24-18 win over Troy
thread.title_full: South Alabama holds on to 24-18 win over Troy

title: South Alabama holds on to 24-18 win over Troy
text:
South Alabama holds on to 24-18 win over Troy AP 
Oct 3, 2015 at 10:50p ET +  50p ET 
TROY, Ala. (AP) Cody Clements passed for 205 yards and two touchdowns, and South Alabama's defense came away with a needed stop in its 24-18 win over Troy in the Sun Belt Conference opener for each team Saturday night. 
Troy (1-3) started its final drive at its own 17, trailing 24-18 with 3:29 remaining. South Alabama's Akeem Lewis stopped Brandon Burks for no gain on fourth-and-1 from Troy's 43, and the Jaguars were able to run out the clock on the ensuing possession. Burks finished with 83 yards on 26 carries and caught four passes for 20 yards. 
Kalen Jackson - six tackles, two tackles for loss and two interceptions - led the defensive effort for South Alabama (3-2). 
Xavier Johnson scored on a 1-yard run in the first quarter and ended with 94 yards. Josh Magee had 118 yards receiving and Gerald Everett caught Clements' two touchdown passes.
